summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, alleging widespread SEC corruption, obstruction, and failure to act on his information regarding money laundering shells, abusive naked short selling, and fraudulent schemes involving numerous individuals and entities. He references his own TCRs (Tip, Complaint, or Referral) and appeals a preliminary denial of his award application.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, alleging SEC corruption and detailing various fraudulent schemes involving money laundering shells, naked short selling, and specific individuals/entities. He is appealing a preliminary denial of his award application.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's emails, referenced as failing to produce the record for his award appeal and being part of the SEC's alleged obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's emails, referenced in the context of the SEC's Office of the Whistleblower (OWB) and alleged obstruction.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's emails, mentioned alongside Janey and Hoecker.

persons.name: Bill Scigliano
persons.context: Described as Chairman BoD and a Director at Oleg Firer's Acies Corp, linked to Jaclin money laundering shells.

persons.name: Oleg Firer
persons.context: Referred to as 'His Eminence' and a 'prolific Bag Man'. His entity Acies Corp is linked to money laundering shells.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Linked to Jaclin money laundering shell PRComplete/YESDtc via GRQ. Described as a 'Bag Man'.

persons.name: Keener
persons.context: Referenced as 'Bag Man Justin Keener/JMJ', involved in money laundering shells, barred by FINRA in 2013, and involved with Blink Charging (New Image Concepts).

persons.name: Farkas
persons.context: Referenced in relation to money laundering shell Skyway. Michael Farkas is CEO of New Image Concepts/Blink Charging. Jonathan Farkas is suggested as a Trump 'Bag Man'.

persons.name: Engel
persons.context: Described as a 'Milken/Drexel flunkie' on the Blink Charging (BLNK) Board of Directors.

persons.name: Jonathan New
persons.context: Referenced as the former NETE CFO and now CFO at BLNK (Blink Charging).

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chair Jay Clayton, accused of not disclosing conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell and Jared Fishman, and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Described as a Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Chair Clayton who played a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT running.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Linked to Hanover/Magna and various shells (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH). Subject of an SEC complaint regarding bogus notes.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving NETE.

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving NETE.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: Referenced as being in possession of Dilorio's 2013 TCR.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: Referenced as the recipient of Dilorio's 2013 TCR filing.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower corresponding with SEC official Janey, alleging obstruction and failure to act on his information.
Scigliano was a Director at Oleg Firer's Acies Corp, linking them in the context of alleged money laundering shells.
Both are labeled 'Bag Men' and implicated in money laundering shell schemes, with Keener later involved with Farkas's company Blink Charging.
Both are linked to Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman is accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT running, which Clayton allegedly failed to disclose conflicts about.
Both are described as 'Bag Men' involved in fraudulent schemes and money laundering shells, with their activities detailed in Dilorio's TCRs.
Brothers and co-founders of SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which engaged in pump-and-dump promotions.

events.title: Dilorio's Email Alleging SEC Corruption
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends emails to SEC officials (Janey, Hoecker, Jay) forwarding previous appeals and alleging extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and cover-ups related to money laundering shells and fraudulent schemes.

events.title: Formal Appeal Submission
events.description: Dilorio submits a formal appeal for the preliminary denial of his covered action award application (2015-016/Knight Capital TCR & Appendix), summarizing hundreds of previous emails.

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA bars Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for inadequate anti-money laundering programs and failure to comply with information requests.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC brings a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC, Ajay Tandon, and Amit Tandon for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotions of Net Element (NETE).

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC files a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing a 'shell factory' operation, which included New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

keyFacts: Christopher J. Dilorio, a whistleblower, alleges the SEC is engaged in widespread corruption and obstruction, intentionally protecting entities and individuals involved in money laundering shells and naked short selling while denying his rightful award.

Dilorio links numerous individuals (e.g., Oleg Firer, Bill Scigliano, Barry Honig, Justin Keener, Michael/Jonathan Farkas) to a network of 'money laundering shells' and 'Bag Men' operating through entities like PRComplete/YESDtc, New Image Concepts/Blink Charging, Skyway, and Net Element (NETE).

The document claims the SEC's Office of the Whistleblower (OWB) and officials (Janey, Hoecker, Jay) failed to produce the record for his award appeal and have actively obstructed investigations into the schemes he reported.

Dilorio alleges that Knight Capital/KCG/VIRT (NITE) is a criminal enterprise engaged in abusive naked short selling to facilitate money laundering, and that the SEC facilitates this through mechanisms like the DTCC's Obligation Warehouse (OW).
The emails reference connections between alleged fraud schemes and political figures, suggesting 'Trump prolific Bag Man Jonathan Farkas' and 'BLNK/Trump/rinsing' with 'Rusian money'.
